","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"What types of funds are necessary to bid at the Public Trustee sale?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"  ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Certified funds, equal to the lender’s minimum bid plus $50, are required and must be presented to bid.  Funds must be payable to the Douglas County Public Trustee. Some properties will be continued (postponed) week to week due to a bankruptcy stay, a pending cure, a request from the lender's attorney, or other reasons","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}},{"value":". ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"14.6667px"}},{"value":"Also, if we do not receive a written bid from the lender by 12:00 noon two business days prior to the scheduled sale date, we will automatically continue the sale one week. ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Where do I obtain information about other liens against properties?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"  ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Liens recorded against a Douglas County property may be obtained by contacting a Title Company or researching through Douglas County Clerk and Recorder.","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}},{"value":" ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"9pt"}},{"value":"Please be aware, there might be other liens outside of Douglas County. ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}},{"value":"PLEASE NOTE:","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline"}},{"value":" The Public Trustee does not know if the lien in foreclosure is the first lien. "}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Does the Office of the Public Trustee conduct seminars about the foreclosure process?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"  ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"No. The Public Trustee's office does not conduct seminars for potential investors, or curious observers. A sale date will be established and scheduled 110-125 days from the date of recording the NED or 215-230 days if the property is agriculture. ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"black"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Are Taxpayer dollars used to fund the Public Trustee's Office?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":" ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}},{"value":" ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#2379a9"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"No tax money is used to operate the Public Trustee's office. *","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}},{"value":"C.R.S. 38-37-108: All moneys payable to a public trustee at any foreclosure sale under the provisions of this article or upon redemption or cure pursuant to article 38 of this title shall be in the form of cash, electronic transfer to an account of the public trustee available for such purpose or a certified check, cashier’s check, or teller’s check, or draft denominated as an official check that is a teller’s check or a cashier’s check as those terms are defined in and governed by the “Uniform Commercial Code”, title 4, C.R.S., made payable to the public trustee and certified or issued by a state-charted bank, savings and loan association, or credit union licensed to do business in the state of Colorado or a ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}},{"value":"38-38-104)","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"14.6667px"}},{"value":", in order to preserve your right to cure, this notice must be filed with the Public Trustee’s Office at least 15 calendar days prior to the date of sale, or the first scheduled date of sale, or any later date to which the sale is continued. If the sale date is continued to a later date, the deadline to file a notice of intent to cure by those parties entitled to cure is also extended.  The Public Trustee will notify the attorney for the lender, and they will provide an amount necessary to cure the default. We will notify you immediately when we receive the information from the attorney. Also, you should contact the Douglas County Housing Partnership at 303.784.7856 or your lender to determine if foreclosure mitigation/loan modification services are available to you. ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":" ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"9pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"What happens once I have filed an Intent to Cure with the Public Trustee?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"},"url":"https://www.denvergov.org/content/denvergov/en/denver-office-of-the-clerk-and-recorder/foreclosures/frequently-asked-questions.html#2cbc7e57-7a69-427e-90d5-502c9c31d6cd"}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Please do not expect to receive the cure statement immediately after filing this form. We must request information from the lender’s attorney. The cure statement is due back to us within 10 business days of our request, or eight calendar days prior to the scheduled sale date, whichever is sooner. If the Intent to Cure is filed after the deadline, the foreclosing party has no obligation to provide a cure statement. If the Intent to Cure is filed timely and prior to the deadline, the property will not be sold until after the lender's attorney has provided a cure statement to the Public Trustee.","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"14.6667px"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"I received a foreclosure notice from you in the mail. Do I need ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"to move?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"  ","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"You still own the home and have the rights and obligations of a homeowner until the property has gone to sale and has been deeded to a new entity. If you do not move out after the foreclosure sale, you may be subject to eviction proceedings by the new owner of the property. ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":" ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Will I receive a notice if my house is sold at the foreclosure sale?","textStyle":{"fontWeight":"bold","fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","textDecoration":"underline","color":"#117395"}},{"value":"  ","textStyle":{"fontFamily":"Calibri","fontSize":"11pt","color":"#117395"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"No. You will receive a second foreclosure notice from us on or about 60 days prior to the first scheduled sale of the property. No further notices will be sent. The scheduled sale date can be continued by your lender.
